greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into exactly k different parts with distinct multiplicities; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=max{i:A000292(i)<=n}, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..120, flattened
example: T(4,2) = 1: [2,1,1]; part 2 occurs once and part 1 occurs twice.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t, s) option remember;
add(`if`(j in s, 0, b(n-i*j, i-1, t, s union {j})), j=1..n/i))))
g:= proc(n) local i; for i while i*(i+1)*(i+2)/6<=n do od; i-1 end:
mathematica: b[n_, i_, t_, s_] := b[n, i, t, s] = If[Length[s] > t, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i-1, t, s] + Sum[If[MemberQ[s, j], 0, b[n-i*j, i-1, t, s ~Union~ {j}]], {j, 1, n/i}]]]]; g[n_] := Module[{i}, For[ i = 1, i*(i+1)*(i+2)/6 <= n , i++]; i-1 ]; t[n_] := Table [b[n, n, k, {}] - b[n, n, k-1, {}], {k, 0, g[n]}]; Table [t[n], {n, 0, 30}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 19 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 01 2012
